reviews.review_msg: Deniz is a very responsible professor. He's always willing to help his students outside of class. Even though the assignments and final project(currency report) could be a bit challenging, you will learn a lot out of it in the end. If you put effort into his class, you would achieve a satisfactory grade!

A good guy! Solid choice for a professor. His email answers are vague but his office hours are way better and were the most helpful when I did not understand things from class. Makes you do 3 assignments, 1 final currency project, and two exams.
Deniz is a prof who is always willing to help you outside of class. You will get what you put in to the course. Great guy.

Hes one of the better profs at SFU but beware he has VERY strict classroom rules such as 
- no cameras pointing at him (so dont stand up ur ipad) 
- No phones at all, esp if it rings
- Be early or u get told off pretty bad

His teaching is verbal so listen. Participation worth 15%. Major group project worth 15%.

She seemed to now know the material well, as she used slides that were directly from the internet and just read them during lectures. I would avoid taking her class unless you have to, most of it will come down to luck and hoping that she just likes you as that will be a large determinant of the group paper mark.

All multiple choice exam and none of the questions come from anything she provides, nor the textbook. It comes down to guessing, and the best part is that if you speak to others in the exam she will not care at all.

Unfortunately I had nobody else in the course to collaborate with on the exam so I didn't do so well.
